title: Popular skincare trends in the 2010s
text:

This decade was a shout out to pursuing beauty with responsibility. We show you how skincare trends evolved from donning just a flawless face to feeling beautiful inside out.The fondness for grandma’s DIY recipes came to the forefront with the treasures that Ayurveda has to offer. These traditional cures act as nature’s way of customised treatment by offering remedies based on the body’s requirement. It takes into consideration the elemental characteristics, aka doshas—Vata, Pitta and Kapha—where it’s important to strike the right balance among the three for optimum health. The stresses and diet deviations of a modern lifestyle disturb this balance, leading to skin and hair problems. Specific, personalised remedies are formulated to target the issue with natural ingredients, restoring the balance.The western way of layering for a flawless look lost its ground as Korean traditions took over the beauty sphere. Think glassy finesse, off-beat natural ingredients, and masks galore. K Beauty is too big a revolution to be termed as a mere trend. It introduced a thorough, 10-step cleansing, toning, moisturising and perfecting regime to the world. On the one hand, tinted and colour-correcting creams made the foundation-finish an everyday affair, and on the other, toners solidified their place in daily routines. This era also brought much-needed attention to exclusive eye care.Considered as a close understated cousin of the cool K Beauty, J Beauty attracted attention for promoting similar holistic healing, albeit with a relatively simpler approach. It is reinventing traditional self-care practices of Japan that aim at enhancing natural beauty, making them an easy millennial fit. Drawing glow from deep cleansing and purifying, J Beauty works on a simple mantra that says—hydrate, hydrate, hydrate. Bank on this one as face serums and a well-nourished glow emerge as the latest trends of the decade.
